attributes.action: Stop infringing human rights of the UK and to stand up for liberty. And to not make life in the UK unbearable
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The news is that

The government is compiling a database to track and store the international travel records of millions of Britons.

And they plan to limit our plane journeys to 2 a year.

Addresses, travel itineraries and credit card details could be kept for up to 10 years.
But opposition MPs and privacy campaigners fear it is a significant step towards a surveillance society. 

This must stop now!

The government  dont care about freedom or our rights. What is going to become of this country
And they say we have nothing to fear, well we have when we have government like this in power
The government says this is essential in the fight against crime, illegal immigration and terrorism.


To trap us in our own country is illegal and against human rights. We must speak up speak out for freedom
liberty for life.

The government cannot do this. The UK is becoming a police state. It has to end.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
